body_html: Sadly one nasty part is the integration with Google's Cloud Dataflow like in this example. You now have the choice of having TensorFlow (supporting only Python 3.5) or Apache Beam SDK (supporting only Python 2.7), but not both. 🙈
body_text: Sadly one nasty part is the integration with Google's Cloud Dataflow like in this example. You now have the choice of having TensorFlow (supporting only  Python 3.5) or Apache Beam SDK (supporting only Python 2.7), but not both. 🙈
body: Sadly one nasty part is the integration with Google's Cloud Dataflow like in [this example](https://cloud.google.com/blog/big-data/2016/12/how-to-train-and-classify-images-using-google-cloud-machine-learning-and-cloud-dataflow). You now have the choice of having TensorFlow (supporting only  Python 3.5) or Apache Beam SDK (supporting only Python 2.7), but not both. 🙈
